resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

kszucs commented on issue #5562: ARROW-6763: [Python] Additional testing requirements on Travis (s3fs)
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5562#issuecomment-537452346
 
 
   @jorisvandenbossche we already list the test-only dependencies in conda_env_python.yml, so I think It is better to ass s3fs to conda_env_python.yml which is used only for setting up development environments.

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #5562: ARROW-6763: [Python] Additional testing requirements on Travis (s3fs)
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5562#issuecomment-537454416
 
 
   The test-only dependencies in `conda_env_python.yml` right now are mostly the required deps to just get the tests running, which certainly needs to be installed in a dev environment. 
   But the question is if we want to install all optional test deps also in the default dev environment for contributors. Eg, I think we should also add `fastparquet` to this file, but that's maybe not something that should be added to the base dev environment? If it would be just for `s3fs`, I agree, we can just add that to python environment. 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #5562: ARROW-6763: [Python] Additional testing requirements on Travis (s3fs)
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5562#issuecomment-540057704
 
 
   `hypothesis` is a required dependency for running the tests at the moment. `pandas` could be moved, but this is an optional run dependency, not only optional test dependency, and I would argue that out contributing docs should by default construct an environment that contains `pandas` (which is not necessarily the case for all optional test dependencies such as fastparquet)

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #5562: ARROW-6763: [Python] Additional testing requirements on Travis (s3fs)
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5562#issuecomment-540063963
 
 
   What I said above: I wanted a way to add some additional packages to the test environment on travis, without adding them to the main python environment file that is also used for setting up a development environment.
   
   I now added s3fs because that was the case I ran into when I opened the PR, but actually also wanted to add `fastparquet`
   
   This is assuming that 1) we actually are OK with adding those to the test env on travis, and 2) that we rather not add them to the main python env file for creating a development environment. 
   
   If the second assumption is not correct, I am happy to remove this file and move it into the main `conda_env_python.yml`. 
   And if the first assumption is not correct, then we should discuss where we *do* want to test them (one of the ursabot builds?)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #5562: ARROW-6763: [Python] Additional testing requirements on Travis (s3fs)
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5562#issuecomment-540063963
 
 
   What I said above: I wanted a way to add some additional packages to the test environment on travis, without adding them to the main python environment file that is also used for setting up a development environment.
   (I now added s3fs because that was the case I ran into when I opened the PR, but actually also wanted to add `fastparquet`)
   
   This is assuming that 1) we actually are OK with adding those to the test env on travis, and 2) that we rather not add them to the main python env file for creating a development environment. 
   
   If the second assumption is not correct, I am happy to remove this file and move it into the main `conda_env_python.yml`. 
   And if the first assumption is not correct, then we should discuss where we *do* want to test them (one of the ursabot builds?)

issuetype.description: A new unit, integration or system test.
issuetype.name: Test

fields.description: Currently the s3 parquet test is skipped on both Travis as ursabot
fields.summary: [Python] Parquet s3 tests are skipped because dependencies are not installed

comments.body: I think this is outdated. S3 tests are now run on a variety of CI configurations.
